title: A1466 820-00165-A no green light
message:
Hi,

I have an A1466 820-00165-A without green light.

PP3V42_G3H = 3.4V

On PPBUS_G3H I only get 8.17V and on  SMC_RESET_L I get 0.027V

Can you help?

title: A1466 820-00165-A no green light
message:
Must fix SMC_RESET_L first.
Post U5110 voltages (all pins).
If all good, remove R7100 and test the signal again.
Check R5100 and be sure J6100 is clean.
If still the same, remove U5110 and check if signal goes high.

title: A1466 820-00165-A no green light
message:
R5100 had 50K and I replaced. Now it has 97K ohm

J6100 seams OK

U5110:
1=3.4V
2=0V
3=3.4V
4=2.751V
5=0.115V
6=3.4V
7=3.4V
8=3.298V

It seams that  SMC_RESET_L  is low. Shall I replace U5110?

title: A1466 820-00165-A no green light
message:
Why didn't do the mentioned tests?
SMC_RESET_L is low for some reason...

title: A1466 820-00165-A no green light
message:
I didn't do the tests because I  thought that the value of pin 5 was bad, and  thought that there was no reason to proced (my bad).

Even without  R7100 and without  U5110, I get 0.99V on  SMC_RESET_L

I think that something is burning R5100, because I already replaced 3, and the third is bad again (23k ohm). It seams that it burns with powering on after a few tries (not sure if it makes any sense...)

title: A1466 820-00165-A no green light
message:
R5100 was never burnt.
Onboard measurment will always show lower value.

You have a problem with SMC, or accumulated crap underneath.
Try first reballing it.
If still the same, change SMC.

title: A1466 820-00165-A no green light
message:
It was the SMC. The reball was  enough.

TKS!
